abstract: At least 18 people are killed in political violence in Egypt on fourth anniversary of Arab Spring uprising, in display of ruthless crackdown by military-backed government; deaths of high school student Sondos Reda Abu Bakr and activist poet Shaimaa al-Sabbagh capture nation's attention.
lead_paragraph: The deaths came on the fourth anniversary of the Arab Spring uprising, a reminder of the ruthless crackdown the military-backed government has used to silence any echoes of that revolt.

byline.contributor: Merna Thomas contributed reporting from Alexandria, Egypt.

snippet: The deaths came on the fourth anniversary of the Arab Spring uprising, a reminder of the ruthless crackdown the military-backed government has used to silence any echoes of that revolt.

headline.main: At Least 18 Die in Egyptian Violence
headline.print_headline: Two Deaths Stand Out in Violence in Egypt
